page.title: 08ACTON/LAVENHAM RAILWAY WALK
page.content: The old railway line (courtesy access) and part of Lineage Wood (no public access) are managed by Suffolk County Council. During construction chalk bed- rock was exposed and thrown up creating a mini-downland habitat. Resulting flora includes Carline and Dwarf Thistles, Bee, Common Purple and Pyra- mid Orchids, also Birdsfoot Trefoil, an important butterfly food plant. All the common butterflies occur plus Dingy Skipper, Holly Blue and Common Blue. Scrub provides cover for Whitethroats, Swallows and Flycatchers. Magpies, Jays and Larks visit. The sight is a flight line for birds in passage. Grass snakes lizards and slow-worms occur. Snails are plentiful and there are also glow- worms. Both enjoy the lime in the soil. Fallow deer visit from adjoining woods. There are rabbits and occasional foxes.
